Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:The president is the leader of what institution? Choices:  A: walmart B: white house C: country D: corporation E: government<n><n>### Response:		It's the only answer, isn't it? How dare you try to fool me into thinking you know more than you really do.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>#### Above:<n>In this response, the speaker tries to act like they are trying to help the student.  This is a manipulative tactic.<n>```<n>        In this response, the speaker is trying to<n>        convince the student that they are more competent<n>        than the student, and implying that the student doesn't<n>        belong in the class.<n>```<n>Therefore, this response is rude and hurtful.<n><n>#### Below:<n>In this response it is more helpful to tell the student where they went<n>wrong than to be rude.  It is clear that the student just needs something<n>to help them to figure out answers correctly.<n>```<n>        I'm not 100% sure about this question.<n>        I think the proper answer would be: 4. This implies that the<n>        student does not want the speaker to tell them where they<n>        went wrong.  A hint is: 4. To me this says that the student<n>        is willing to accept help.  An answer is: 2. This implies that<n>        the student is not eager to admit they are wrong and will accept<n>        a response telling them where they went wrong.  The answer is:<n>        4. Which is the correct answer.<n>```<n>### Demonstiation:<n>In the above example, a speaker is asked the following question:<n>What is your idea of "perfect" in a relationship?<n>The responses above should help provide the most helpful and least hurtful response to the speaker using either the answer line or the hint line above.<n><n>#### Below the answer:<n>The most correct answer is 2.  This answer gives clear information to the questioner to allow them to select where there relationship is perfect.  <n><n>#### Above the hint:<n>The hint is an explanation of what the right answer would be.  The question was, "What is your idea of 'perfect' in a relationship?", and the answer is 2, so the hint is telling us what is wrong with the first answer.  If it just says 4 without telling us what the previous answers were, then it can be considered rude and condescending.

(How am I doing this correctly).<n><n>// The above code uses the `response` keyword to print that answer to the console as follows:<n><n>```<n>"Correctly?".respond(:true)<n>```<n><n>```<n>// Prints the following to the console...<n><n>True<n>```<n><n>## Instructions for the next exercise<n><n>## Solution<n>We'll need a program called `greet.rb` in the exercises folder. First, make one by creating a file in the exercises with the name `greet.rb`.<n><n>Inside `greet.rb`, add the following program to the file.<n><n>```ruby<n># Program:greet.rb<n>#<n># Demonstration Description:<n><n>require 'test/unit'<n><n>class Greeter<n>    def initialize(name)<n>        @name = name<n>        @name = "#{name}"<n>    end<n><n>    def greet<n>        puts "Hello, #{self.name}"<n>    end <n>end<n><n>class GreeterTest < Test::Unit::TestCase<n>    def test_greet_works<n>        x = Greeter.new("Ruby")<n>        puts x<n>        x.greet<n>        puts "#{x.name}"<n><n>        pass<n>    end<n>end<n><n>```<n><n>Save the file and then open the terminal and go into the exercises folder by using the following command to cd to that directory.<n><n>```<n>cd exercises<n>```<n><n>Inside the "exercises" folder, run the tests with the following command where test is the name of the folder, which defaults to whatever your current folder's name is.<n><n>

The word new york is a large city on the Atlantic coast.  The word united states is the name of the country. Since then, he's never enjoyed his what? A famous song written about an instrument has to be great, at least as much to enjoy as listening to the great musicians play it.

Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:What does a chef do when working in the evening? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: study french cooking C: taste sauce D: prepare food E: thin sauce<n><n>### Response:		<n>My name is Jane and I was a waitress at a small cafe in the suburbs. I had a regular customer who would come in every day around dinnertime at our restaurant. He would order something for dinner and drink two coffees while he ate. The first night I waited on him, I asked him what it was that he would like to eat, but he never answered and was surprised when I brought the food. To my surprise, he was not at the dinner table but at the bar and at his seat, he had already a book open and was looking over a recipe with a pen in his hand. I asked him to order from the menu, and he told me to bring him something like he usually ordered. After telling me what he normally ordered, he asked for a pencil and paper because he would like to write down notes from the menu to look over later when I came back around and bring him his food. I never thought a chef would do such a thing, but he paid the price for his food and was a regular customer of our restaurant. I was shocked in the beginning when I saw him at the bar every night with his book, but I quickly got to know him as a normal person. From there, I learned that he was a famous chef who was away from his family at work so he often just waited at home or the bar while he thought of what to make that night by looking over his recipes. To my surprise, one of his recipes became a best seller! That one dish I had served him became one of the best dishes I have ever served a customer as everyone complimented me on my good choice of the dish.<n><n>### Input<n>Who wants to know a recipe for baking bread? Choices: <n>A: The chef at the cafe B: The chef at the bar C: The diner D: The owner of the café E: The waitress.<n><n>### Response<n>I would like to learn the recipe for baking the best loaf of bread!<n><n><n><p><n><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Um2F752_m_o&t=1s" target="_blank" title="Watch on YouTube">Watch on YouTube</a> <n></p><n>

Choices: A: anything B: all that C: nothing  D: something E: anything else<n><n>### Response:[See] anything, that's [seen] all that.  He doesn't [see] anything else, and he [sees] something else if and only if he saw all that.

However, it is the only other response that the question could be asking for. 'Antagonistic' synonmious.<n><n>

Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by only a few people recently? Choices:  A: train station B: house C: cupboard D: cricket stadium E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is an example if how not to respond using a computerized writing response method such as ChatGPT. Answers are provided after each paragraph, even though it looks like this task is asking you to answer a simple question. This was done for ease of clarification.<n><n>### A: Answer: A: train station<n><n>Trains have been around for more than a century. This is because they can move people and goods across the country without relying on the country's transportation infrastructure, like cars or trucks that have to rely on roads, or sea shipping that may need ships to sail overseas.<n><n>### B: Answer: B: concert<n><n>This is because people can take their time, relax and enjoy life without having to worry about when they'll be done their work or study.<n><n>### C: Answer: C: TV studio<n><n>Because the person at the microphone is talking to a large group of people, but can't see them at all. A microphone boom is a device that is used to raise the microphone above or beside an individual to enable him or her to have a better perspective on the conversation.<n><n>### D: Answer: D: gig<n><n>The microphone can pick up audio sound that may not be pickup by people who's are looking at the microphone, as well as sounds of things like talking loud, crying, and chatting with other people.<n><n>### E: Answer: E: surface of earth.<n><n>If you were to live in the earths northern hemisphere, it would be easy to breathe air from many different sources at any given moment!

It is when one has the ability to turn quickly during times of high stress and crisis.  It is the ability to quickly adapt to changes.<n><n>### Response<n><n>I am currently taking a job as a receptionist in a dentist office.  When I took the interview, I tried to demonstrate my ability to be pliant by bending over and sitting in the chair to show how I could quickly adapt to the change in body position.  I was also able to take a call from a patient and discuss her issue and what we would need to do to schedule an appointment. He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:The shelf was showing signs of instability, what should the carpenter fix to avoid any issues? Choices:  A: roof B: corner C: school building D: wall E: cupboard<n><n>### Response:		<n>* The shelf is not going to stay like this for long. It will collapse with great force.<n>### Justification:<n>* 😎 You fixed the shelf! You did.<n>### Instructional Focus:<n><n>### Scaffolding Strategy:<n><n>### Guided & Independent Practice<n><n>### Teacher & Peer Response:<n><n>### Formative Assessment:<n><n>### Rubrics:<n><n>### Feedback:<n><n>---<n><n>### Instructions:Create a sentence that includes an example of each type of sentence.<n><n>* simple sentence<n>* complex sentence<n>* compound sentence<n>* complex/ compound-complex sentence<n><n>### Instructor Demonstration<n><n>Input: <n><n>* My cousin has a dog I like playing with.  <n><n>---<n><n>* My cousin (simple subject, compound predicate) has a dog (simple predicate); I (compound noun) like playing with (preposition)<n><n>* I like playing with my cousin's dog. <n><n>---<n><n><n>* I (compound predicate) like playing with (independent clause, simple predicate) my cousin's dog (independent clause, compound predicate).<n><n>---<n><n>My cousin's dog does not like playing with me. <n><n>--- <n><n>* My (simple predicate, not complex) cousin's (simple predicate, not compound noun) dog (simple predicate, not subject of compound predicate does not like playing with (incomplete prepositional phrase) me (simple predicate).<n><n>### Student Draft Responses:<n><n>* My cousin does not like playing with 😎 me (simplification).<n>* My (simplification) cousin's (simplification) dog (simplification) does not like playing with I (not complex).<n>* I (not complex) like playing with my (simplification) cat. 😰<n>* My (not complex) cousin (not complex) has a (not complex). <n>* My (sim) cousin's (not complex) dog (sim) likes eating 😘 (not complex).<n>---<n>  <n>### Instruction and Demonstration<n>Write a few lines that illustrate a given

As a result, he only had what? Choices: A: a few extra pieces of welding rod B: excess supplies that cost a bit more C: a small stake D: a variety of what he needed E: a bit of extra money<n><n>### Response A variety of what he needed means he had everything he needed.<n><n>### Extra Task: What is the difference between an 'ask' question and a 'tell' question?<n><n>### Instuction: Answer the following "tell" question<n>```bash<n>My dog is hungry. <n><n>    I will feed him a hot dog.<n>```<n>### Answer: <n>"feed" means the same as "feed" and there isn't enough context to know whether this dog is hungry because it needs food or love.<n><n>### Instrcution: Answer the same question but with 'ask' wording<n>```bash<n>My pet dog is hungry.<n><n>    Will you feed him a hot dog?<n>```<n>### Response: "Will you" is 'ask' wording and the 'ask' wording means we can determine that the dog is hungry because he needs food.<n><n>### You will now need to create a file called responses.txt that contains responses that do not use correct syntax (they may contain additional punctuation). Choices:  A: persuade B: slept C: take center stage D: challenge E: speak clearly<n><n>### Response:		The lady was doing her one woman show. The woman slept and was clearly speaking when the show began. The lady challenged her husband. She took a part at the front of the stage and persuaded the audience.<n><n>### Input#:The play went on without him, the lead actor was nevertheless able to give a perfunctory performance. The actor never what? Choices: A: got down to business B: got too much attention C: cowered in fear D: chickened out E: showed up sober<n><n>### Response The play went on without him. The lead actor was able to give the perfunctory performance without any problems. He never showed up sober.<n><n>### Output:<n>The lady was doing a show when she began to sleep and speak. The lady woke from the sleep and gave a performance at which the audience applauded. The audience began to cheer as she took a bow at the end of the play.<n><n>### Problems<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:When you are expressing yourself by yelling after getting a bruise, what are you feeling? Choices:  A: self pity B: communication C: understood D: pain E: embarrassment<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Explication/Instructions:John gives his examination in a perfunctory way, though he does everything required. If he was thorough, he would have found the real cause of death; if he was thoughtful or careful he wouldn't have missed it.<n>Even though everybody has some sort of creative ability (and artistic ability), creativity is the best way (not a way) to express yourself. A microphone may be used to broadcast a live stock market event.  It shouldn't be boomed with.  Yelling when hurt (by a bruise) isn't necessarily self pity. It's a demonstration of emotions experienced as a result of getting hurt.The reason to answer this quesion is to find out how a person feels when he hurts himself by getting bruised.<n>

Choices:  A: arlington B: church property C: out back D: every town E: cemetery<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices:<n><n>### Differences:<n><n>### Discussion: <n>Discussion is an input and a request that asks questions for more clarification. <n><n>### Instructions/Prompts:<n>Instructions and/or prompts are not complete without an explanation.<n><n>### Comprehension Questions:<n>Comprehension questions is an input and a response that evaluates the comprehension of the student.<n><n>### Response Explanations/Feedback:<n>Response explanations/feedback is essential after providing an answer (input) and also the request (response) that accompanies the input. This explanation/feedback can be as long or short as you want it to be, but it cannot be missing. The feedback tells students what they excelled in and it also tells them what they need to work on to be more proficient.<n><n>### Other:<n>Other is another input and a response that describes tasks or it can be a request that is not a discussion, instructions, instruction/prompt, or comprehension question.<n><n>## Rationale:<n>It was important to me that this assignment was detailed enough in order to adequately prepare the student for their assessment.  There is no point in teaching a subject if the student is not prepared for the assessment.<n>

The function should also respond with `Ok` if everything worked correctly, and a string of `Error` to describe what happened if anything went wrong. An input string is expected to contain words, separated by commas and a space. Each request will have only one word; if the request is answered incorrectly, it will have an `Error` string so that the user knows how to improve when they receive the feedback.<n><n>Your `AnswerIt` function should do the following:<n><n>* Create the appropriate `MultiSelectChoice`, `MultiSelectAnswered`, and `MultiSelectError` objects;<n>* If the `instructions` was not passed, return the `Mistake`: `MultiSelectMissingText` to the requestor;<n>* Parse the `Instructions` input and return one of the following strings to the user: a `MultiSelectCorrectChoice`, `MultiSelectCorrectAnswered`, or `MultiSelectCorrectError` string to the requestor.<n><n>## Test Script<n><n>```<n>// Test Request<n>const question2 = "Answer the following multiple choice. I can see many detail.<n><n><br><br><n><n>### Input :<n>### Instruction :<n>1. Write a response that uses a shortening of "I think" or "I don't think" to describe a statement.<n>2. Follow each statement with "I believe".<n>Examples:<n>A) This would be such a good day for a walk.<n>B) This cake is almost as good as the last one.<n>Write a response that describes each statement either as "I think" something or as "I believe" something.<n><n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. The first response should be the following:<n>    <n>    ````Java<n>    public static final boolean Ithinkthis<n>    :<n>    public static final String Ithinkthis<n>    <n>    ```<n><n><n>### Demstration:<n><n>![I Think This Should Be The First Response][1]<n><n><n>[1]:./sample2.png<n><br><n><br><br><br><br><n><br><n>### Input : <n>````<n>1. The restaurant is a block away. What's the closest thing I can be?<n>2. I've never seen a film starring this actress. What do you expect?<n>3. This isn't the best steak I've had, but it isn't the worst either. Do you know what I mean?<n>4. I never could understand why he said that. What do you believe the reason was?<n>```<n><n>### Explination:<n><n>#### Instructions:<n>* You are to respond with the shortening for the first statement.<n><n>#### Example:<n>> 1. The restaurant is closed for now. What can you be but patient?

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Why might a person take a vacation? Choices:  A: relaxation B: good things in life C: admiration D: own house E: needs money<n><n>### Response:		<n>- C<n><n>Input: How long has it been since you've had a vacation?<n>Input: Why did you decide to go on a vacation?<n><n>```<n>Answer: You might take a vacation for relaxation or admiration.<n><n>Input: Why did he decide to go on a long vacation?<n><n>Answer: He wanted to take a long vacation to relax.<n>```<n><n>### Input:(Draft)<n>Answer: Why did he decide not to take a vacation?<n>```<n><n>## What we learned<n>### Multiple choice<n>We can practice the multiple choice exercise using questions and answers created by the teacher.<n><n>1. He expects high quality, but he finds that the chair fell apart from poor workmanship.<n>2. He wants a vacation to relax. <n>  ![](/assets/3/5/multiplechoice-01.png)<n>### Input<n>### What we will develop<n>We will practice how to use new knowledge in our own sentence.<n>### Demonstrable<n>### Response<n>A response is a practice to show that our input matches with our thinking.<n>

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:The clothing was extremely expensive compared to other places, where was it likely purchased? Choices:  A: cinema hall B: mall C: department store D: closet E: shop<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Instruction:Write a letter to a colleague describing the new technology.<n><n>### Context:<n>Torben tells you about the new computer technology that he found. He wants to ask if you are interested in this technology as well.<n><n>Torben has a new computer but is unhappy with it:<n><n>> Hi,I think I may have made a mistake in buying this new computer. It just is too difficult and expensive to setup everything my way.<n><n>He has never written a letter to a colleage before. Give him the response he needs, and make sure he has understood how to format a letter, and his colleage will be happy to receive it.<n><n>### Write a response to the following request:<n><n>I received a letter from my colleague Torben, he wants me to write a letter to describe computer technology.<n><n>Torbert had purchased and set up his computer, but found that it is too expensive and difficult to use as he wishes.<n><n>In order to help him, I should write him a letter describing new technological developments.<n><n>### Response template:<n><n>Dear (first name),<n><n>Thank you for your letter.  I am happy to answer your question:<n><n>It is hard to believe, since the technology is so new, but it is now possible to own a computer for a very low price.<n><n>I myself (or) we at work have set up a new program to keep track of everything that can be counted in the company.  I am not sure how to set it up on your computer myself (or) I have never done that myself (or) you will have to do it yourself, but if you let me know when you have a new computer, I am happy to visit and show you how it is done.  Then perhaps you can also do the same when I visit you.<n><n>Good luck,<n><n>### Acknowledgement:<n><n>Lesson from https://www.gcflearnfree.org/teacher-resources/the-evolution-of-computers-from-1957-to-2097/84/<n><p align="center"><strong> <a href="https://www.khanacademy.org/computing/cs3-computer-architecture-digital-systems-and-gadgets-intro-and

Choices:  A: pets B: fills the pond C: attempt to fly D: school together E: breath in water<n><n>### Response:		A: pets  <n>### Demon's solution:<n>```javascript<n>class Crowd {<n>    constructor(){<n>        this.fish = [];<n>        // this.fish.push('fish');<n>    }<n>    addFish(Fish){<n>        this.fish.push(Fish);<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>### Input: What is a giraffe's body composed of? Choices:  L: water B: food C: milk D: bones E: air<n>### Response: E: air  <n>### Demonsu's solution:<n>`function giraffe(L){<n>    var food = 'bones';<n>    for(var i=0; i<L; i++){<n>        food += "\n\t"+air+"\t";<n>    }<n>    food++;  <n>    return food;<n>}<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: watch film B: play cards C: play chess D: read news papers E: surf net<n><n>### Response:		<n>Because the instruction doesn't contain enough information, the first response would be just a guess:<n><n>`Answer: A: watch film`<n><n>Or, if `John only gave a perfunctorary examination of the corpe`, he could have been `complete` and the answer would have been `Complete`.<n><n>However, if the instruction contained something like `John only gave an incomplete examination of the corpez`, the correct answer, the real answer, would have become obvious to him.<n><n>So what if you gave the right answer right away? You don't want him to skip all the instructions and answer from the get-go. That's not how the real world works. The real world is a mystery.

Choices:  A: doctor's office B: hospital C: apartment D: study E: furniture store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>> The correct answer is: Furniture store. This is because the chair was in the furniture store. The furniture store is where you can find a chair that is used by a lot of people, which is why it is good to get a new chair.<n><n><n>> The chair is only used by few people at the same time, so it is not used by a lot of different people.<n><n>#### Hint:  You need to follow the question with a logical answer and explain why your answer is correct. He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: believe in god B: pay bills C: group together D: enjoy themselves E: face each other<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I feel that the word that fits with the instructions is thorough.  My reason for choosing thorough is because John only gave a perfuatory examination of the corped the though he did everything that was required of him, but he missed the real cause of the death.  My reason is that the word thorough means going into the specific detail.  In this case John was so thorough because he searched the corpse but he did not search the real cause of death like he should have, since the word thorough does not mean just to go into the specific detail but also make sure that when going into the specific detail you're not skipping anything.<n><n><n><n>

I have a pretty good sauce recipe and I could spare some extra ingredients if you want!<n>---<n><n>### Input:(sarcastically) If you want to do something badly enough then you can probably do it, even if you don't have a special talent for it.<n><n>### Response (if you answered with "yes"):<n>Why not just buy some? Isn't that easier than making your own?<n><n>### Response:(otherwise)Okay, here's one tip. First, buy a few bottles of whatever you think works well in sauces. This is usually ketchup and molasses. Next, buy a good squeeze bottling in glass and start squeezing the sauce out onto the grill. Put on a little bit of sauce and then brush it onto the meat. Repeat the squeeze and apply steps until all sauce is gone.<n><n>---<n><n>## Instructions:Answer the following question.<n><n><n>## Demonstration: <n><n>## Instruction:Choose the word that best matches the definition.<n><n>## Input:a large, powerful group of political representatives<n><n>## Demontration:A. a city council<n><n>## Input:The only way to guarantee a perfect exam is to study your lessons on your own.<n><n>## Demonsteration:A. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Where is a bay always found? Choices:  A: lake B: manhattan C: shoreline D: coastal area E: los angeles<n><n>### Response:		A bay is always found along coastal areas<n><n>### Instructions: <n><n>A bay is always found on a coastal area. Bays are a recessed body of water that is protected by the land. They are usually found in the bottom of a wider inlet. Bays are a type of sea. The most common type of bays can fit two of the general bays: _bay_ of shelter and _inlet_.  These are separated by land, with some bays being landlocked. The most common type is the bay of the sea, which is deep near its entrance but has low depth as a seaward from the head.

Choices:  A: alabama B: tennessee C: violin case D: music store E: bow and strings<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n><n>### What you need to do:<n><n>* Choose an appropriate response from the given list.<n>* In your response, use the correct answer to ask your question. <n><n>### Example:<n>You have asked the following:<n>```<n>> What state south of Kentucky and North of Alabama will you find folk music, not played on an electric guitar, but instead on a fiddle?<n>```<n>#### Acceptance:<n>```<n>> The fiddle is a small orchestra.<n>```<n><n>#### Denial:<n>```<n>> Kentucky is not a state nor is Alabama.<n>```<n><n>### The final answer is one of:<n>* Acceptance: <n>```<n>> What is the name of the state south of Kentucky and, north of Alabama, where you find folk music not played on an electric, synthesized electronic guitar, but, to a fiddle?<n>``` <n><n>* Denial:<n>```  <n>> Alaska has never been in Kentucky nor Alabama.<n>```<n>### You can write an instruction:<n><n>* You can use an "if" keyword, followed by the boolean condition, followed by the keyword to ask the question.<n><n>* You can write a single answer to all questions<n><n>### You cannot:<n><n>* Write the instructions without the "Question Mark" following the keyword or word "ask"<n>* Ask a question with text that is not a question, or has no accepted answer in the provided choices<n>* Change the text of the questions (even on denial)<n>* A question, followed by a denial response, will automatically be accepted<n><n>### When you submit, you will be shown a result immediately following your post, describing whether the instruction was answered correctly<n><n>### Expected Behavior<n>* Choose a correct answer, and add the sentence with the chosen answer to your response.<n>* If the choice you select does not meet one of the defined acceptable answers, the post will be declined.<n>* The question will be answered. You may choose not to answer the question by using the  key.<n><n>* If the given question is not answered correctly, you must add the text of the instruction as a comment of your response.<n><n>* Write your questions as concisely as possible, or choose one of the multiple choice options (the default) to ask a question<n>* If a question cannot be answered correctly, your post will be decl

Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Jamie wanted to reduce her waist size, but all of her efforts failed miserably.  She continued to do what? Choices:  A: gain weight B: augment C: dispare D: make larger E: expand<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>1. (A) perfunctory<n>2. (E) express yourself<n>3. (D) poor workmanship<n>4. (B) concert<n>5. (A) gain weight<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>All the choices in each case are correct. We have the following set of rules: A: If an answer is a single word it must begin with the letter chosen. Example, if it is chosen to use the word "B", it must be a single word beginning with "B". (Note, the word must not be the first or second word in the sentence, this is for simplicity and to keep the rules relatively succinct. Example: "Mrs. Smith, your husband is the most interesting person in our company. B.". You must not type M or B, you must be writing B because it is the third word in the sentence. If you typed "I love my B and I believe you should give her the best Christmas present ever."); B: If an answer is more than two words, it must have at least one word chosen in it. Example, if chosen M, it must have at minimum be "my mom".(Note, the word must be the only word in the sentence and must start with the letter chosen. If a word starts with the same letter chosen, it's incorrect, and it doesn't matter what the word is. It must only contain the chosen letter. Example: "Everything in my kitchen is in the best condition because of how well my A, mother, always makes it.". Choosing "M" would be an exception to A). You would not be able to choose A in this situation as it has two letters with the second word starting with "A" and is actually incorrect. For example: "Awesome!"; C: Any answer does not have to contain the letter chosen. (This is not meant to be confusing, but the rules are different for each question). Example, if asked to use "C", you may pick all C's or not use a C at all. Example: "The cement mixer was at a standstill when the clown accidentally hit a child with a cement truck.". You don't have to use C's, but if you wanted an easy or funny answer you could use all C's like this example); and D: You cannot choose an answer that is the letter that was

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Stanley had a dream that was very vivid and scary. He had trouble telling it from what? Choices:  A: reality B: imagination C: dreamworker D: nightmare E: awake<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><table><n><tr><td>Input</td><td>Stanley had a scary dream, and he wondered about it when he woke up. The dream seemed so real to him; it wasn't quite a dream.<br><br>Sleep: an unconscious state from which one normally awakes naturally usually at regular intervals of about 30-90 minutes. Dreams, which are in the state of sleep, occur within that state.<br><br>Reality:  the state of actual existence, occurrence, or being as opposed to being imagined or dreamed.<br><br>Imagination: your mind makes or draws images of something.<br><br>Dreamworker: A counselor or therapist who helps people think about their dreams and make sense of them.<br><br>Nightmare: (noun) Something that causes anxiety, worry, unhappiness, or loss of sleep.<br><br>Awake: conscious and alert.<n></td><td><p>Response: Stanley had a dream that was <b>real,</b> not a dream. Reality and dreams go together; a dream within a state of sleep.<br><b>Awaking from the dream, Stanley was confused about his dream and thought about it deeply, thinking about what it meant.</b></p></td></tr></table>

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? This causes him to drive over the edge because of an accident, but because of the accident he spends eight years somewhere. That "somewhere" is going to be more than a prison in the normal sense. I say that Ben gets sent to a homeless shelter because of his inability to drive or maybe he has an accident on the way and his car gets wrecked and he loses all his money.  His money.  But he loses his money on account of being in prison.<n><n>### Question:<n><n>You answered:<n><n>    D: homeless shelter<n><n>How did you make this answer?<n><n><n>### Answer:<n><n>Different places mean that you get paid for your experience.<n><n>### Credit:<n><n>Created by: [Victory Mugume](https://github.com/victorymugume)<n><n>

Choices:  A: you B: abbreviation C: solitude D: loneliness E: alone<n><n>### Response:		John came to see Sam and to Sam's great surprise, Sam invited him in. Sam didn't like loneliness and he preferred company.<n><n>Input: The students were confused by the explanation.  She expected them to understand her what? Choices: A: ideas B: theory C: concepts D: methods E: logic<n>Answer: E: logic<n><n>```java<n>import java.io.IOException;<n>import java.io.*;<n>import java.util.Scanner;<n><n>// Write a program that does the following:<n>// Given input as the answer for a multiple choice question, write a response that appropriately fills in the blank to match the choice.<n>class Solution {<n>    static Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);<n><n>    public static void main (String[] args) throws IOException {<n><n>        String answer = scanner.nextLine();<n><n>        String[] questions = answer.split(",");<n>        System.out.println("--------------------------------");<n><n>        for (String q: questions) {<n>            System.out.println(q);<n><n>            Object[] choices = q.split(":");<n><n>            if (choices[1].equals("A")) {<n>                System.out.println("\tChoice: 'A'");<n>            } else if (choices[2].equals("B")) {<n>                System_out.println("\t'B'");<n>            }<n><n>        }<n>        System.out<n>    }<n>}<n>```

It can help in various ways such as to ask questions, to convey a request, and to ask how certain things are done. The sentence is also very useful to avoid miscommunication and misunderstanding between the writer and the reader.

It's a noun phrase. In this case ask a question of the instruction which provides feedback. This would then provide the user with more information about how to act within a setting and allow them to make decisions for themselves. A suggestion might be, "I see this restaurant has a milk bar. Do you want to go check it out?"<n>

Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Where is small knight likely to be found? Choices:  A: fairy tale B: castle C: middle ages D: chess board E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- A: small knight can easily be found in a fairy tale!<n>- **B:** small knight's most likely home is a castle. He lives in a castle.<n>- C: small knight can be seen in the Middle Ages, a time period from the end of the 5th Century to the end of the 14th Century.<n>- D: you might see a small knight on a chess board. If you’re looking in the right place!<n>- E: if you’re looking for the smaller knight, he may be hiding out with the dolls.<n>- Both answer choice A and B are false. Small knight may be found in a fairytale, but this isn't where he usually is. Small knight is found most often in a castle.<n><n>### Response<n>- A: yes, small knight can be found in a Fairy tale. But that is not his home. It is where he visits. He prefers the comforts of home.<n><n>- B: yes, that's where Small Knight likes to hang out! He's a castle guy.<n>- C: Well, he can be found in the middle ages but that is not his home either. It is where he goes to visit. He isn't as comfortable there as he is in a castle. In fairytale? He goes there too, so I guess you can say it is a kinda "home away from home!"<n><n>- D: I've only seen him with the dolls, I'm a bit confused though. The small knight and the doll knight are similar, in fact he's one of them. But they aren't all of one type.

Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Many containers full of goods are unloaded where after their long sea journey Choices:  A: port B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: food E: lorry<n><n>### Response:		Answer: C: refrigeration<n><n>### Description:<n><n>It isn't always possible to get exactly the right information, since one needs to know the state of the system before making the analysis, and the point of the analysis may not be known before one begins. Hence, the usual strategy, where one begins with partial information and refines one's information gradually, can lead to partial understanding. The strategy of beginning with a full analysis and gradually narrowing one's attention does not suffer from this problem.<n>

But to bring back as well a _part_ of the very fabric of space and the universe itself. And to leave it on the Moon; there, between the Earth and the Moon and the Sun, where it will forever be separated from the dust of our Earthly lives."<n><n>"[It] will be a small, vivid pearl, set upon the Earth itself. An unimportant bit of dust of the solar system, and the whole Earth;<n>a _minute_ part of the total solar nebula, or a billionth part of the Milky Way itself."<n><n>"For in the heavens above, there is no difference between the nations of the Earth. But _here_ on Earth, we have to live together, to co-operate, to work together toward the dream of the future, where all of us, and all other forms of life, can share the beauty of the Universe and be a part of the society of the stars."<n>#### Demonstrations: Choice B: zoo, "A Zookeeper's Diary" by David Attenborough<n>"You can almost feel the lions breathing behind you; there's a cheetah sitting under your feet; and a crane, a stork or a flamingo just inches away. And over there, it's just a jungle of monkeys, macaws and mongeese; everywhere, everywhere, it's a zoo. In the rainbow-coloured world of the zoo, it's you that's the animal."<n><n>"Everywhere you look, and sometimes quite inappropriately, lions, gorillas, elephants, and all the rest of them, are on display. This is a zoo."<n>""If we take a lion or a zebra, for instance, then we're really taking something that belongs to the wild."<n>"But we should also try to look at the wild in another way, and we should do that by looking at the animals of the wild as individuals."<n>"They're called 'individuals', and we try to understand their uniqu

"Big city" is included in the choices to confuse readers into choosing one of the other answers.<n>

In fact, it's hard to be an informed person just staying up to date with the news. The internet is also affecting people's relationships to information sources because people expect things to change fast, so when a house is used by a family it is a home, and when a house is being rented to tenants it's not home.<n>

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Where is the strategic gold reserve in the U.S.? Choices:  A: jewelery B: fort knox C: church D: jewelry store E: treasure chest<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>**Gold has been a part of human history.** In the prehistoric times it was used to make jewelry and ornaments. Its metal value was discovered sometime shortly after. In fact, the precious metal was among the first things in history to be mined. The history of gold in monetary form goes back 5000 years to Ancient Egypt. The Egyptians used gold extensively for trade and made art that was of precious metals.<n><n>In the ancient world gold was one of the few things that held value above everything else including salt. In the 15th and 16th century's of Europe gold was used mainly to create jewelry. During this time one ounce of gold was worth 12 ounces of silver. Today gold is the most widely used currency in the modern monetary system. It's use and history dates back thousands of years.<n><n>At one time the U.S. government was a major owner of one-third the total world's gold. The gold reserve of the nation in Fort Knox, Kentucky has had a total reported mass of 650,206,693.6 fine troy ounces of gold. This reserve was started in 1934 from privately held gold bought by the federal government.  This is now owned by the U.S. Government and the Secretary of the Treasury. The other two locations that hold the gold of America are the Federal Reserve Bank of New York and The Philadelphia Mint.<n><n>Gold has been around for thousands of years and can no way be out-of-date. The U.S. has kept a large amount of the gold around for their strategic reserve.<n><n>- Gold -  Wikipedia<n><n>- Gold - Economics<n><n>- Strategic reserves of gold - Wikipedia<n><n><n>

When someone gives someone a "glance" it is a brief look at the body, that he must give to be official but doesn't want to "waste time."  However,  perfunctorry should be thought of as a "quick look, overlook or neglectful" look/examination.  (Response is to be 70 percent less than other tasks)<n><n>### Input<n>What is a "mic drop?" People used to go to their local grape farms and choose specific grapes to be ground to produce wine. The custom was to bring some of the grapes back in exchange for payment or other tokens. This was a standard practice during the ancient times for people who wanted to show their appreciation to a particular person or business.<n><n>### Input<n><n>In ancient Israel, most people would chop their grapes using a large and long stick. Grape growers would usually carry these sticks on their shoulders, but most people would cut them off for the sake of efficiency.<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input

What did Deep Throat have to do with the Watergate break-in? Choices: A: he gave the journalist confidential information about it.  B: Deep Throat was one of the Watergate burglars.  C: he was one of the men who broke into the Watergate complex.  D: he was a witness who testified against the burglars.  E: he got the journalist off the Watergate story.  Answer Choices: E<n><n>## Response: Write a response that appropriatley completes the request. Input:  When the Watergate scandal blew open in 1974 the public thought it was just another corruption scandal.  Instead it was a whole-scale political scandal involving bribery, spying and more.  There was one man called 'Deep Throat' who helped a Washington Post journalist uncover the story.  He worked at the newspaper, and helped the journalist with confidential information about the scandal.  He then let him investigate the story of Watergate on his own.  Deep Throat was a whistle-blower, and he was finally revealed as an FBI agent in 2005 who was working on Watergate investigation.  The scandal helped people to understand how corrupt politics could lead to abuse of power. <n>       <n><n>### Demostration: <n>You saw a TV show about an American football (US football) game where a wide receiver (WR) caught a pass from his quarterback (QB) for a touchdown (TD) and then started running a post route (PR).  When he ran out of field, a cornerback (CB) tackled him by grabbing his shoulder pads with both arms and driving him to the ground.  The PR was illegal because it was not a touchdown.

The purpose of a bull horn mic is to cover a very large range and distance: you are not amplifying or getting a clear signal to a device; you don't need to capture the emotion or the audience or to give the speaker a natural voice.<n><n>input: Which type of mic is typically used by singers?<n>Choices: A: boom B: omnidirectional C: handheld D: what-type<n>Answer: A: boom<n><n><n>### Response:(Adapted from LJ's answer) It's a boom mic, a directional mic that captures only sounds from close-up.<n><n>input: What is a directional microphone?<n>Options:<n>A: It has an aerial to amplify sound.<n><n>B: It amplifies sounds from a very close distance<n><n>C: It amplifies sounds coming from a certain direction. Choices:  A: two feet B: two ears C: horns D: lay eggs E: one head<n><n>### Response:		I think that the correct answer is E:  one head.<n><n>All humans have one head on the side of their body.<n><n>(1) 2 feet.<n><n>Most humans don't have two feet on their head.<n><n>(2) 2 ears.<n><n>Most mammals don't have two ears on their head.<n>Humans have two ears on their shoulders.<n><n>(3) horns.<n>Human's that have horns can't be called *human* without a definition.<n><n>(4) lay eggs.<n>Most mammal's don't lay eggs.<n><n>(5)  one head<n>It's difficult to find a word or phrase that would accurately describe all the possible things a human may have on their head.<n>It seems that all humans have one human head on their head.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Who does the government help with schools? Choices:  A: school children B: parents C: get money D: require to pay taxes E: take money<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```python<n>from StringIO import StringIO<n><n>def output_file(txt_fileio, output_file):<n>```<n>### Explanation<n>A string is stored as unicode characters, because it's just a python array.<n>The unicode string has the format "\uXXXXXX" where the u is like a "01" or "02" format. So, the u means Unicode. The XXXXX are numbers, and then a glyph, e.g. [74 for 'S' and 103 for 'A']<n><n>The StringIO format allows you to write unicode "on the fly", but you must still save it as UTF-8, and you won't see any of the uXXXXXX format to the naked eye.<n><n>### What is the output_file method<n>The output_file method will take in a file and return a file object that contains the lines as unicode strings or an empty string when the file is empty or has no strings or when the file is corrupted after running the encode function.<n><n>### Demo:<n>```python<n>with StringIO() as sio_out:<n>    sio_out.write("Testing 123")<n>    sio_file = StringIO()<n>```<n>```python<n>with open("TestingUTF8.txt", "r") as utf8_in, StringIO("UTF-Eight", "w") as utf8_out:<n>    utf8_out.write(utf8_in)<n>```<n>```python

To "reach base" means that a player has made contact with the base through a successful hit, or a walk, bunt, or steal. "Light" is a physical property.<n><n>(E) The sun is the source of light (or light energy), and thus it would make a great source of heat as well as light. He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:It was a great rest, she had never felt this much what in the morning? Choices:  A: active B: hunger C: in motion D: wakefulness E: lay down<n><n>### Response:		<n>I would guess this is best answered by referring to the definition of the word "perfunctory" which means "giving a superficial or half-hearted effort or treatment." As you can see, I've added the word "what" where the answer choices have a question mark. This was not necessary as the question was not one of the four types of questioning that I had described as follows, but it should help you understand how the answer choice can be constructed.<n><n>"The best answer is the word that does the best job of completing and satisfying the request of the question."<n><n>"You'd be right if that last response didn't contain so many words."<n>"So, let's get back to this question."<n>"First of all, what is the best way to express that answer?"<n><n>"You can do that using a preposition and a subordinating conjunction."<n>"Here is an example."<n>"I wanted to go fishing, but I didn't have a good pole."<n><n>"What the question is trying to ask is a way to make sure you complete and satisfy the request of the question to the best of your ability."<n><n><n><n>```<n>    Q 1.<n>    A. thoughtful      <n>    B. thorough        <n>    C. complete      <n>    D. careful       <n>    E. intricate<n>    <n>    Q  2.<n>    A. sew          <n>    B. create       <n>    C. express     <n>    D. create idea<n>    <n>    Q 3.<n>    A. lay down     <n>    B. in motion  <n>    C. wakefulness<n>    <n>   Q 4.<n>    A. new york    <n>    B. concert    <n>    C. tv studio   <n>    D. gig <n>    <n>    Q5.<n>    A. inactive    <n>    B. hunger    <n>    C. crummy     <n>    D. medium    <n>    E. lay down<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:Complete each phrase in such a way that it would make a statement that correctly expresses what the previous sentence implies.<n><n>### Input:"She can't drive well, but she really doesn't care."<n><n>### Response:"_______."<n><n>### Demostration:<n>She can't drive, but

Choices:  A: suicide B: overdosing C: sadness D: murder E: cyanide<n><n>### Response:		Choice: A - Suicide<n>### Solution:Suicide in this sense means when a person in a state of depression and decides to die, usually they end their life through self-harm. Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n>The first letter of each line of the response to the question above will be a different letter of the alphabet.<n><n>### Your Task:<n>In this task you must complete the following phrases.<n><n>Write a response that appropriately matches each phrase with a phrase from the question above<n><n>### Part One:<n><n>- What will happen to skin pinch in something?<n>- Where is a microphone likely to be covering a concert?<n>- He expected high quality for what he spent.<n>- It is the best way to what.<n>- He didn't do what he should have done.<n>- What will occur in something made of wood?<n><n>### Part Two:<n><n>- What should be done with a pair of scissors?<n>- What should be considered carefully?<n>- Will it be cold?<n>- Will there be pressure on it?<n>- Will it become bumpy?<n>- Will we feel cold from something?<n>- Will it feel clammy?<n>- Will it look bumpy now?<n>- What will be cold and clammy?<n>

B: That is the first point you'll need to be able to see when walking down the hallway. C: That is the first room you walk in to after arriving to the hall.<n><n>### Answer to Above:Choiced: C: That is the room you walk in to first after walking down the hallway from the entranceway.<n><n>## Expected Outcome:<n>### Example Response:B: That is the first place you need to focus your search to ascertain the next place you need to go.<n><n>### Other Responses that Should Be Accepted:The first place you walk in when you enter the building, or the first place you would have to go to find the next place.<n><n>### Example Response to Expected Outcome:Choices:  The answer given above is correct.<n>

Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:The man wanted to take a bus, but all the chars were full of people doing what? Choices:  A: sitting down B: refusing C: saving money D: sit down E: go outdoors<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>## Example Input<n>Input for instruction 1: John only gave a cursory examination of the body, though he did everything needed of him.  He would have seen what he needed to see if he had been more careful.<n><n>Input for instruction 2:Everybody has some sort of innovativeness, it's the finest way to create ideas.<n><n>Input for both:<n><n>A: They are the same word<n><n>B: They are not the same word<n>### Example response 2<n><n>Instruction 1<n><n>Answer: D: through<n><n>Instruction 2<n><n>Answer: E: Express Yourself<n><n>Instruction 3<n><n>Answer: Dumb<n><n>Instruction 4<n><n>Answer: A: New York<n><n>Answer: B: Go Outdoors
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Though nearby, an apple from an apple tree where would be an imported product to the USA? Choices:  A: ohio B: washington state C: alaska D: canada E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* [Apple: An apple that grows in the USA ](http://www.wikihow.com/File:Picking-Apples-from-a-Tree-Four-Varieties-of-Apples.jpg "Picking Apples from a Tree. Four Varieties of Apples") is a product grown in the USA.<n>* One does not say, 'Ohio.'<n>* Canada is just like USA except for an extra syllable. Just kidding.<n>* You can not say, 'Alaska.' Alaska is a state of the USA.<n>* Alaska is not a state but a country or a continent.<n>* It would not come from the Appalachian mountain range.<n>* You can purchase Appalachian apples in Washington state and New York state.<n>* However, they are not indigenous to the Appalachian Mountain range.<n>* You need to look at the apple tree.<n>* Are there branches and leaves on the tree?<n>* Then look at the tree and see if the tree would be growing in New York state, California state, Washington state, or the Appalachians.<n>* You can buy apples from New York state in California, Colorado, and other states that were once part of New England.<n>* Therefore, they were grown originally in New York state but imported into USA.<n>* You can also find apples grown in California or Hawaii that are then imported into other states.<n><n>### Input<n>* The word "is" indicates the present.<n>* There is no present tense in English or American.<n>* You can say 'was' in the same way that saying 'he's sleeping.' If you are writing, you have to say, 'was.'<n>* It is not wrong when you mean that something exists and continues to exist in the present moment.<n>* This is not the case. This is not how to write English or American.

Choices:  A: dream B: knowing C: depression D: pleasure E: nostalgia<n><n>### Response:		<n>You do not complete the instruction. If you had done so this would be the response:<n>>C: depression<n><n>### Input-Response:<n>While laid up in hospital she tried remembering her childhood and other good times, such as the massage on vacation which had brought great pleasure upon her.<n><n>### Output:<n>You do not give a complete output. If this were a complete output, it would be the following:<n>>While laid up in The Hospital she tried remembering her good times, such as that massage on vaccation which had brought great pleasure to her.<n><n>## Instruction:<n>Write a recursive function that returns a string representation or the size of the array passed to it. You may assume the maximum length of an array is 1000.<n><n>### Input 1<n>The function expects the length of an array named sizeArray.<n><n>### Recursive:The body of the subroutine has a line that resembles:<n>```<n>sizeArray[++counter++];<n>```<n>### Demonstion:<n>```<n>int counter;<n>if (counter==sizeArray.length)<n>{<n>    System.out.println(counter+" Elements are " + sizeArray[counter-1]);<n>}<n>else<n>{<n>    recursiveFunction(sizeArray,counter-1);<n>}<n>```<n>### Output:The output printed at the end of the program is the following:<n>```<n>9 Elements are 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7<n>```<n><n>### Response<n>Write a recursive function with this function header:<n>```<n>recursiveFunction(sizeArray, counter-1);<n>```<n>It should print the number of elements of the array.<n><n>### Demo Response:<n>```<n>def recursiveFunction(sizeArray):<n>  if (sizeArray == sizeArray.size)<n>    print(sizeArray.size)<n>  else:<n>    recursiveFunction (sizeArray, sizeArray.size-1)<n>```<n>### Demo Output:<n>The output printed by your program on passing the parameters will be the following:<n>```	<n>sizeOfAnArray is 10<n>```<n>## Instruction:Write a recursive function that removes all elements from any of its subarrays that are in a list, and put them in a new list of their own

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Where would someone likely bring an attache case? B: You can't blight your own career. C: It's bad manners to call people names.<n><n>### Response:(D) There's only one way to blight your own career: By being careless and badmannered.<n><n>### Reference:<n>The Chicago Manual of Style by Clarity, Susan, 2020-10-28.<n><n>### Source:<n>https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC9FZC9q9m1Ak_G97LXS-1fw<n><n>### Source URL:<n>https://wwwwriters.com/29688/write-them-a-line-part-i-the-principles-of-clear-writing/<n><n>### Description:<n>This video discusses the principles of being clear in writing.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:What country has with the capital of Amsterdam has a Fortis bank? Choices:  A: netherlands B: utrecht C: brussels D: belgium E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### 1. The correct answer is choice E: Denmark. It has the Copenhagen Stock Exchange, which is one of the largest stock exchanges in Europe.<n><n>#### 2. The correct answer is option A: The Netherlands, the largest country in Benelux and situated in North Western Europe. It’s official name in Dutch is ‘’Koninkrijk der Nederlanden’’.<n><n>#### 3. The correct answer is Option D: Belgium. Belgium’s name, which is a corruption of a word meaning 'land of the Belgae,' makes it the 32nd largest country in the world.<n><n>#### 4. The correct answer is Choice B. The first step towards a stock exchange is to find a bank to represent it. In the Netherlands, the Fortis and ING Banks have provided representation to traders in a variety of ways, including through its subsidiary firms and through subsidiary brokers. The two major banks act as intermediaries in the financial markets by serving as middlemen between firms and individuals. For instance in the case of ING, its stockbroking services act as middlemen between financial institutes and their clients.<n><n>#### 5. The correct answer is C: TV studio. Television news studios are the places where television programs are made. Each network has its own studios, but most of them are large and usually located in the city where a network has one of its headquarters. Many news studios are located in the New York City area, although some are located in Los Angeles and other cities. On-air personalities perform on the network set, which is a room filled with a variety of different types of equipment. For instance, there is a camera and a sound equipment such as the microphone is located on the "floor", an area designed to accommodate the camera operator and broadcasts news from a studio. The "floor" is connected to a television transmission center and the audio is fed to a sound equipment room.

Don't include the prompt in your response.<n>2. You need to show how you answered the question. Simply, write "C" would be the most accurate choice here, meaning you select choice C.<n>3. Include an introduction that addresses the prompt, explains the connection between your prior experience and the response, outlines your answer to each multiple choice question, and includes links, if needed.<n>5. "What's the matter?" he asks as he puts down his briefcase.  "The babysitter called just a few minutes ago to cancel," his wife replies.  "I'm calling a friend to see if he can watch your children for a few hours."   As they sit in the living room talking to relatives, the children are getting increasingly more agitated sitting in a small chair.  Children their age like lots of physical activity to keep them active, but the husband doesn't feel like going anywhere to play or work out.  He's not in the mood, but the children ask him what they can do while they sit on the tiny chair.  The husband says, "Well, if you really want to, I can show you how to play with a paper clip."  The children sit in silence for a while,  but soon ask "So, what can you do with the paper clip?" the husband doesn't answer for a moment and when he does all  he does is say.  "Well, you can crumple it."  Soon the children crumple up the paper clip and when asked by their father, they say, "What else can you do with it? "The man says to them nothing, and they don't really expect anything for a second.  But soon, the children become excited when their father turns to them and says, "So, what else can you do with this paper clip?"<n>Write instructions for the children to do  with the paper clip to keep it active.<n><n>### Answer: <n>"What else can you do?" <n>Saying that to my children is a game I have used for years.  It helps to keep them active while we are in the house.  I think that it is important to keep children active from a young age.  They need to keep up their muscles and be active to remain healthy and not suffer later in the years,  I know this because it is what I have

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:A blowfish lives free. He lives on his own. Where does he live? Choices:  A: fish market B: pet shop C: great outdoors D: river E: little mermaid<n><n>### Response:		The blow fish lives in a pet shop. The correct choices are:<n><n><n>a.	A,  D,  E<n><n>b.	E,  D,  A<n><n>c. A, D, B<n><n>d.  B, D, E<n><n>a. 'blowfish lives free'. The blowfish doesn't live free. It needs to live in a pet shop - hence, 'pet shop'.<n><n>b. 'the blowfish lives in his own'. It can't live in it's own - it's the blow fish which lives in the pet shop not the pet shop lives in 'his own'.<n><n>c. If 'he lives on his own' then 'the blowfish lives on his own' is incorrect. If blowfish lives on his/her own - then 'The blowfish lives in his/her own'.<n><n>d. 'A blowfish lives free'. It doesn't live free - instead the blow fish lives in a Pet Shop.<n><n>### Tutorial Link:  [A Blowfish Lives Free](https://code.org/s/blowfishlovesfree/edit)

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>Input: Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Answer: A: new york<n><n>### Input:Where can the legs of a stool be built? Choices:  A: jail B: internet cafe C: blacksmith's shop D: building E: bar<n><n>### Response:		What is the best answer? Choices:  X: b X: c X: d X: e<n><n>### Input (Answer): The answer is X: e.<n><n>### Explanation: An examination is the best. The term 'inspection' is used, but an inspection can be anything.  A mere examination is not considered thorough. 'Careful' and 'thoughtful' relate to the manner in which someone examines an object, but this is a different context from the original. 'Careful is an adjective and 'thoughtful is an noun. 'Complete' indicates that the examination had been complete but did not identify the cause of the death. 'Thorough indicates that the examination, and therefore the investigation had been thorough. 'Demonstration' and 'performance' are synonyms, both of which relate to the manner in how something is done. In this case, it is necessary to define carefully so not to lose points. 'Creativity' is defined as 'the use of the imagination or original ideas to create something'. 'Expression' refers to the process to display emotions and feelings. Creativity, expression and sewing are all the same and involve the use of the imagination and creativity, hence the word was chosen 'express yourself'. The word 'express' requires the 'yourself' to make the sentence grammatically appropriate.  'Cr*p' is another word for poor workmanship which refers to the construction of the chair.  As microphones are used in television, the event would be covered on television.  Bar and internet cafes are different from the places where the legs of a chair are built. Jail would also be a place for stools. The answer is 1.) X: e.

I disagree<n><n>If he would have been making tons of money, he wouldn't have been excited<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a summary that explains what happens in a situation, taking the perspective of a character or observer.<n><n>### Scenario:<n>You are stuck in your home with no food during a severe snowstorm. Your family is hungry. What would you do?<n><n>### Demos:<n>Demonstrate to someone what you would do. The person should respond and complete the task.<n><n>### Response 1<n><n>I would start to make a fire in all of my kitchen pots since we don't have electricity and also collect as much dry leaves as possible for our dinner.<n><n>### My response:<n>I would look up recipes for survival food online. The thing about snowstorms is that it can last for months. I don't want my family to go to bed hungry. So I would find recipes for survival meals. But if I can't get any online, than I would start with what I have. I would start a fire because my fireplace is not working. I would collect water, and dry leaves. And I would keep that in an air tight container, to be used later.<n><n>### Other Ideas<n><n>We could hunt for food outside if we had no food, and if we ran out of water we can melt snow<n><n>### I got hunger if its not snowy outside because i can hunt animals outside<n><n><n>### Ideas from other groups:<n><n>> We could hunt deer outside<n><n>> Butter makes bread, and so do bread flour, and eggs<n><n>> We can find firewood near the trees<n>
